revised_title: Mercurial Vapour Poisoning on the Crew of HMS Triumph
tldr: This study examines the effects of mercury vapour exposure on the crew of the HMS Triumph after a shipwreck in 1810. The crew experienced ptyalism, ulcerated throats, and other symptoms due to the mercury-contaminated provisions. The severity of the poisoning was linked to the proximity of the crew's living quarters to the source of the mercury vapour.
